title: "Oath"
context: §1-21 &ldquo;Oath&rdquo;. The word &ldquo;oath&rdquo; includes a solemn affirmation. [CC 1859, §19; RL 1925, §18; RL 1935, §19; RL 1945, §18; RL 1955, §1-26; HRS §1-21; am L 1973, c 31, §1] Cross References Constitutional provisions, see Const. art. I, §7 and art. XVI, §4. Right to affirm instead of swear on grounds of religious belief, see §621-12. Rules of Court See HRCP rule 43(d); HRPP rule 6(h); DCRCP rule 43(d). Case Notes Judicial oath in common use is legal oath. 8 H. 259.
